DataElement.preferredName: Flow Cytometry Zeta-Chain Associated Protein Kinase Performed Biospecimen Testing Status
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The testing status of a protein tyrosine kinase in the syk family of kinases, with signaling functions in the T-cell receptor (TCR) signal transduction pathway.  Associates with the zeta and CD3 chains of the receptor.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Flow Cytometry Zeta-Chain Associated Protein Kinase Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information related to a protein tyrosine kinase in the syk family of kinases, with signaling functions in the T-cell receptor (TCR) signal transduction pathway.  Associates with the zeta and CD3 chains of the receptor.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A technique for counting, examining and sorting microscopic particles suspended in a stream of fluid.

Concepts.definition: A technique for counting, examining and sorting microscopic particles suspended in a stream of fluid.

Property.preferredDefinition: A protein tyrosine kinase in the syk family of kinases, with signaling functions in the T-cell receptor (TCR) signal transduction pathway.  Associates with the zeta and CD3 chains of the receptor.:Executed and carried through to completion.

Concepts.definition: Tyrosine-protein kinase ZAP-70 (619 aa, ~70 kDa) is encoded by the human ZAP70 gene. This protein plays a role in both tyrosine phosphorylation and adaptive immunity.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: NCCTG CRF:North Central Cancer Treatment Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._A procedure for critical evaluation._A condition or state at a particular time.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Indicates that a test was not performed.

Concepts.definition: Indicates that a test was not performed.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A finding of normality following an examination or investigation looking for the presence of a microorganism, disease, or condition.

Concepts.definition: A finding of normality following an examination or investigation looking for the presence of a microorganism, disease, or condition.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated VM Short Name to be the Public ID to be consistent with current convention for VM Short Name - DW 10-03-2022

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A finding of abnormality following an examination or observation confirming something, such as the presence of a disease, condition, or microorganism.

Concepts.definition: A finding of abnormality following an examination or observation confirming something, such as the presence of a disease, condition, or microorganism.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.:A procedure for critical evaluation.:A condition or state at a particular time.

Concepts.definition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.
